JOB DESCRIPTION:
Job Title Sr Software Engineer 

Location(s) Kerala Thattil Nadakalan 

Summary 

The ideal candidate will have experience developing software for electromechanical systems such as multi axis robots,  hydrodynamics,  and a variety of sensors including optical and ultrasonic.  You will use your development and troubleshooting skills in building and maintaining integrated software- hardware solutions.  You will work on a team that is responsible for the design,  development and delivery of new and existing software platforms that drive all of our laboratory automation and Microfluidic solutions.  You will have the opportunity to work closely with electrical and mechanical engineers,  physicists,  biochemists and molecular biologists.  Experience developing software for to control instruments is a plus.  

Responsibilities: 

Involved in the design,  development,  testing and delivery of new features and enhancements to our Automation and Microfluidic products.  

Work on projects with a distributed team of software engineers and testers both at our Hopkinton facility and with our offshoring partner in India.  

Learn and follow the Product Life Cycle process,  ECO release and documentation and manage the release of software into production 

Support other departments as required including technical support,  field service,  and Integrated Systems 

Maintain professional and technical knowledge at leading edge potential by attending educational workshops,  reviewing the technical literature and participating in professional societies.  

Qualifications: 

BS degree required /  MS preferred plus,  with 5 to 10 years experience in developing instrument control software in medical,  scientific or other relevant field.  

Experience with Agile Scrum,  TDD or other current software development methodologies.  

Microsoft Development Stack,  C#,  C .  VB. NET,  MS Test,  TFS 

Experience with one of more of WCF,  WP,  Prism and COM architectures desired 

Experience developing mobile applications using native or cross platform libraries 

Energetic,  results- driven with excellent organizational and prioritization skills.  

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  

Aptitude to learn new systems and retain technical information.  

Commitment to customer excellence with demonstrated ethics and integrity.  

Ability to operate independently and as part of a team 

Commitment to continuous improvement principles.
